title: Truthlovecoins
author: Truthlovecoins
content: It's one thing to wish to be as rich as Dangote and am sure anyone here would agree to a mentorship program by this man. I consider him one of Africa's greatest entrepreneurs mostly with the completion of Africa's biggest refinery, in Lagos. It is an enormous achievement by a true visionary.So, he was advising young entrepreneurs to be careful in spending their money, mostly as the business is still growing, that living flamboyant lifestyle should be reduced to the barest minimum. Instead the money should be saved or reinvested if the success of the business is the ultimate goal. He said he doesn't have a house abroad and it is not a do die affair to own one. Nigerians has expressed their opinions on the advice he gave, and am asking it here to know what we feel he should have added to the advice of reinvesting, besides saving or not buying real estate abroad?This is the discussion over the radio on Max FM this morning.

If you be newbie here, e no mean say you be newbie for naija. Even small pikin don know wetin dey go on.About that him refinery wey be biggest for Africa with 650,000 barrel capacity daily, we don hear as things take dey happen around him and "his" refinery. Soon now him go soon enter railway building   and we go still say him build railway. Me no just like the way things dey go with the open cabal system. If banks, government and all the politicians put hand for one man dey lift am up plus policies wey dey favour him, make we self dey see road because pesin no go keep him own eyes for house and take our own eyes dey see road.Quote from: Truthlovecoins on July 04, 2023, 07:38:16 AMand am asking it here to know what we feel he should have added to the advice of reinvesting, besides saving or not buying real estate abroad?This is the discussion over the radio on Max FM this morning. Make him one dey advise Nigerian government say make dem build refinery too na. Say make dem refurbish those wey dem say wey dey to dey work well.

Dangote is indeed a successful entrepreneur, and the completion of the Africa’s largest refinery in Lagos is a great achievement. But it’s important to note that such project wasn’t solely financed from Dangote’s personal wealth. Large scale projects like these often involve different sources of funding, partnerships and government support. Let’s not shy away from the fact that so many corrupt Nigerian politicians have hidden under the shadow/name of Dangote to be a part of this project.Anyways, his advice is well appreciated.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: In Nigeria this days it's fast becoming a competition of who is living the best life and we then see people leaving above their means just to feel a sense of belonging. I think that advice for Aliko Dangote is a very important one.As a young man in business, entrepreneur you definitely need to has strong discpline, you have to think more about the future that the present, always try to reinvest and your priority is to further expand your business.
